name: Mandarin Oriental, Boston

reviews.title: GREAT hotel
reviews.text: What a GREAT hotel. I have stayed in many hotels but this was a 5 star experience. I was very impressed from beginning to end. As I made my through the hotel, the hallways, the common areas, I kept noting how clean, and quiet the hotel was. The room was large, CLEAN and quiet. Great bathroom, great shower (how rare is that in a city hotel?). The staff was very polite and gracious. I was there for a meeting, the facilities were fine, comfortable, made for a nice meeting. The hotel bar and restaurant were good. The location was easy walking distance from Back Bay Amtrak station. I made dinner reservations at a local restaurant and got a free ride in a Mercedes sedan without asking for it. Highly recommended, I will certainly go back if given the opportunity.

My husband and I checked into the Mandarin with our 4-month old infant for two nights during Thanksgiving weekend to be close to family staying nearby. We live in the area, so we are very familiar with Boston and all of the high-end accommodations here. Overall, I was very impressed.
reviews.title: Mandarin is a Five Star Family Getaway

likes.liked: — The kid-friendly service and the easy access to the Prudential Center shops

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, the hotel is really beautiful. Design-wise, it is not too distinctive - it feels like a luxury hotel - but they have all the amenities you'd expect and the finishes are top of the line. The room was elegant, but not exactly spacious. The bed was really comfortable, and the bathroom was gorgeous. We really appreciated that there were no pay-per-view movies - instead the hotel will bring you a Blu-ray DVD player and a list of DVDs to choose from - for free. Their selection was very current and diverse enough.
reviews.title: More Hype than Substance

likes.disliked: — Unending traffic in front of the hotel & 'nothing special' high-end guest rooms.

reviews.text: The service was remarkable. Everyone was friendly, phone calls were answered promptly, and special requests were honored quickly. When we asked for our DVD player, an engineer was at our door within 5 minutes. While he was connecting the cables, the phone in our room rang - the operator was apologizing that it had taken the engineer so long to get to us. We had to laugh!

reviews.title: 5 Star All The Way

reviews.text: This is a wonderful hotel for any purpose - business or leisure. It is a new building (only 10 months old at time of writing) and the amenities, decor and overall cleanliness are faultless. Service is probably the best I have experienced (undoubtedly drawing from the 'oriental' background of this hotel group) and very friendly, right from the doorman meeting the taxi to the housekeeping staff. And nothing was too much trouble for the front desk / concierge. The rooms we had were very large with every possible amenity and extremely comfortable beds. As a hotel guest, you can use the vitality suite in the spa and you really should - it is the most relaxing environment with huge whirlpool, steam room and multi-programme shower (not shower as in bathroom - you have to try this to understand!). The bar is great - they can do any drink you can think of and the bar staff are very friendly and really knowledgeable about the drinks they have. Finally, the restaurant (Asana) is well worth a visit with top notch food and an Asian twist (getting away from standard steakhouse menu - although they do a lovely filet mignon and an outstanding Kobe Beef). The location of the hotel could not be better - on Boylston St, surrounded by other great restaurants, yards from Newbury St, very close to Copley Place; strolling to Faneuil Hall takes only 30 to 40 minutes if you are inclined but taxis are lined up outside and there is a complimentary limousine to bring you anywhere within a couple of miles of the hotel. Overall, not cheap, but this is one place where you really do get what you pay for in the best possible way.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel, perfect service, perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once we arrived, we were greeted by 4 different individuals from the time we stepped out of the cab until we got to the front desk, as one would expect at a 5 star hotel. Congratulations were offered at check in as I noted it was our honeymoon when making the reservation. I wish I had asked for an upgrade at checkin, but I forgot. We stayed at 3 hotels in Boston during our honeymoon and this was the only one we weren't offered an upgrade at. Hotel Marlowe and Nine Zero (both Kimptons) win in this regard. We were assigned room 508, a standard King room, were escorted to the elevator, and left to find the room ourselves. I was not bothered by the fact that we were not shown to the room.
reviews.title: Honeymoon Spa Getaway

reviews.text: Initial impressions of the room were very good, but the more we were there, the less impressed we were...more on that in a minute. Within 5 minutes, our bags arrived and the bellhop showed us some features of the room. Another 3 minutes, another knock on the door. They brought up our complimentary beverages which were offered at checkin and some chocolate covered strawberries. How nice of them! We cleared out a space in the mini fridge and put them away for later.
reviews.title: Outstanding service! Looking forward to our next stay at a Mandarin.

Great new addition to Boston hotel scene
reviews.text: THE GOOD- Nice King sized bed with Frette linens, a sectional couch, large (~46") Phillips HDTV (that actually had HD channels) above a large dresser, a separate desk area with stationary, notepad, scissors, paper clips, etc. The bathroom was phenomenal with a separate standup shower with rain shower head and handheld head, a separate toilet room, and a nice soaking tub with bath salts. Top notch hardware for the faucets and dimmer lights finished it off.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THE SHORTCOMINGS- Upon closer inspection, there were several details that were lacking in these rooms, including: 1) the lack of doorstops for the doors. All it takes is one careless guests to open the bathroom door to fast and you've got a 4 inch hole in the drywall. The left closet door smashed into the door frame of the bedroom when it was 70% open, and judging by the marks and dents in the frame, I was not the first guest to discover this. 2) According to the website, each guest room has a walk-in closet. Now come on...no way ours could be considered such. Maybe if you removed all the hangers and ducked below the shelves someone could technically fit in there, but let's call an apple an apple. 3) To the left of the dresser in plain view against the wall were remnants of peanuts. We looked behind the dresser and were disgusted to find other trash and food bits behind there. 4) For only being 8 months old, the dresser furniture was somewhat misshapen. Both doors to the dresser were warped. The left one was difficult to close without some force because of clearance issues, and the right one when closed and touching at the bottom produced a half inch gap near the top. Strange for brand new furniture. 5) Dust had collected and gone uncleaned on the bathroom light fixture lamps. 6) Maybe it was operator error, but the lights in our room had three master switches, one near the door, and one on each side of the bed. Obviously this is so you don't have to go around turning off every lamp before bed...just crawl in and flip the switch. However, without the master switch on, the bathroom lights won't fire on either, thus you are left with a strange predicament should you have to go potty in the middle of the night...either fumble around the bathroom in the dark or blanket the whole room in 60 watt light. Luckily, this situation did not present itself during our one night stay. These issues may or may not be confined to room 508, but in any case this is not what one would expect from a luxury hotel.

reviews.text: Visiting my niece at university I decided to try the new Mandarin Oriental. This was my first stay at a Mandarin and I was very pleased. I also booked a room for her and my sister. Having booked through AMEX Centurion Travel, they upgraded both our rooms and gave us all the extras that come along with it. The style of the hotel was very contemporary but still warm. The location is fantastic for shopping and restaurants and fairly near her school (B.U.). Also made a lot of use of the hotel's Mercedes, which drove us several places nearby. This is a really nice touch for a hotel of this level.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room I was given was very roomy and had an incredible bathroom. I had a nice view over Boylston Street but it was very quiet despite all the activity below.
reviews.title: Impressive, near perfect
dozens of rooms not ready for check-in at 6:30pm
reviews.text: Had a great time the first night in the bar and had delicious appetizers. Breakfast was also quite good each morning. Having stayed in other hotels in Boston, the Mandarin offers a nice change from the Four Seasons, Taj and Ritz - while all very nice, are a bit tired and unexciting. I highly recommend the spa as well. Had the whole Men's side to myself so enjoyed the offerings before a great massage. Bostonians, I would recommend using the spa on a regular basis!

description: Located on Boylston Street in the heart of Boston's vibrant business and historic district, the new Mandarin Oriental, Boston, redefines luxury and blends the simple beauties of Oriental style with New England charm. Accommodations include 136 tastefully appointed guest rooms and 12 suites, some overlooking the Back Bay. Sample refined American and authentic Asian cuisine from Asana, our signature restaurant and visit M Bar & Lounge for exotic cocktails, fine wines, and international tapas. Our Spa, featuring crystal steam rooms, vitality pools, ice fountains, a spa cafe, also has a boutique and a state-of-the-art fitness center.
